Reviews.Title: Good for the price.
Reviews.Author: SWVA
Reviews.Content: As long as this is not your primary TV, this is a good choice for a "bedroom" TV. The bad first: the sound is terrible, but that seems to be pretty typical with a Vizio from my experience. Also, the remote does not have a backlight, which annoys the you-know-what out of me. But, really, it wasn't a deal-breaker to me because all of the components this TV has is hard to find at a decent price as this is. Being a smart TV with wifi, you have access to Netflix, Hulu, etc. through built-in apps. And really, you can hook up a computer or laptop to it for other online streaming that is either "off limits" to certain manufacturers (HBO Go anyone?), which makes this a good choice for me. I also like the fact that this TV is white - it looks much nicer than the standard black/silver/clear - but I do have white trim in my bedroom, so that won't necessarily be for everyone. Overall a good picture - and I hooked up my laptop to it as well to test it out, and it produces a good picture for desktop viewing as well. If you happen to have a little soundbar sitting around that you aren't using.....I would definitely pair it with this TV, and it would be excellent.

Reviews.Title: fired my cable provider
Reviews.Author: k
Reviews.Content: Fired my cable provider and love it.  This is the coolest tv I ever owned.  Can't believe I didn't go bigger.  All TVs should be smart from now on.  It does yahoo, Hulu, crackle, facebook, Pandora, netflix, youtube,and that's just to name a few.  And the price was right.

Reviews.Title: Overall impressive with key flaws
Reviews.Author: Tastinient
Reviews.Content: The price is right, and there's not many white TVs out there. The picture is great and the web TV features work smoothly. The TV is quick enough to turn on and change channels and the remote is nice. It's really attractive looking and a slick package.The stand is just strange, and because the TV has limited viewing angles, it makes a weakness into a big flaw.The thing that will have me returning this though is the terrible speakers. What is the point of streaming music, movies or watching high def if the sound is just low quality. I fault the Vizio designers for not thinking this through. I noticed the 29" model in black has speakers with double the wattage. I may try that model as, again, the set is really impressive in many respects.UPDATE - I bought the 29" model in this series and the sound was improved because of the more powerful speakers. The 29 does not come in white however.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Krista Stewart
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my dorm room and it is the perfect size as well as light and easy to transport when moving in and out of the dorm. The sound is good and picture is great! The remote is small and easy to use as well. I definitely recommend this TV

Reviews.Title: Very Happy with it
Reviews.Author: h2damfk
Reviews.Content: I have a small studio apt and this TV is perfect. Also-white is a nice change. Works great. I watch Netflix all the time on it. Some reviews complain about the sound quality but I'm perfectly happy with it. In fact I bought speakers for it but haven't felt the need to use them. Great value.

Reviews.Title: Th best little TV
Reviews.Author: Sadie and Bow "gerri"
Reviews.Content: I am in awe of this tv. Not only does it fit perfectly on my kitchen counter top...but ,even with an indoor antenna ..it is picture perfect. Love the surround sound.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice, Wish I had kept it instead of giving as a gift.
Reviews.Author: jrgba
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with this Vizio Smart LED tv.  Has more features than I thought.  I wish I had given my daughter my old tv and kept this one.  Extremely easy to set up.  I setup tv then repackaged so I wouldn't have to setup when she opened it.  Tv saved all settings and started right up even after being stored for a month.  That was priceless.

Reviews.Title: I'm Glad I Bought It
Reviews.Author: Matthew Gross
Reviews.Content: Excellent overall performance and ease of use. Picture quality is a notch below the best. Smart feature is fun and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great product with nice features
Reviews.Author: TheWolfTc
Reviews.Content: Great looking tv...very slim and the wi-fi and apps are easy to use and setup. I ordered 2 of these for my boat and 1 for my home kitchen. It goes on and filters...what more can you say?

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: jeloise
Reviews.Content: It has the exact look and style of what I was looking for has good sound and is very easy to use fore either Hulu or Netflix.

Reviews.Title: Perfect fit
Reviews.Author: Andrea Oat
Reviews.Content: Perfect fit for my dresser top .. I like the white color in the bedroom ..picture is very sharp ... This is my fifth Vizio purchase ...

Reviews.Title: not what we hoped for
Reviews.Author: DD
Reviews.Content: Trying to replace our sharp aquos white tv is a hard thing to do.  Wanting a white tv in this size is hard to come by.  Owning another vizio and loving it we ordered this one.  The white is very thin on the sides of the tv and the actual white stand looks cheap and not sturdy.  The brand Vizio is wonderful but I would recommend just getting it in black, and if you want white you probably have to change the size.

Reviews.Title: Incredible value
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: This TV has an incredible picture especially for its size! Delivery was quicker than expected and the price was more than reasonable.

Reviews.Title: Great TV. One Problem.
Reviews.Author: bobj
Reviews.Content: I love the size and features of this TV for the kitchen, especially the ability to stream Netflix and Amazon movies. One issue I have noticed is that sometimes the unit stops responding to the remote as well as the buttons on the back. No volume up/down, no channel or input changing, etc. It basically locks up like a pc. I have to unplug it for a few minutes to re-boot and clear it. I am hoping a future software upgrade will fix this.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Ivy A. Moody "Ivy627"
Reviews.Content: TV works great, the white goes very nicely in my room! Remote and TV are easy to work. I don't use HD on it, so I can't review that.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture
Reviews.Author: Patricia Marter
Reviews.Content: I have it in my bedroom. I love the white border instead of black. Just what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: so NICE.... sleek... THIN!!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Cribb "Happy Consumer"
Reviews.Content: Love this new TV!  Sleek and THIN design!  Love the NO PEDASTAL.....  and the White color!!  I am looking forward to purchasing another one soon!!  Maybe a bit larger on next one!  :-)

Reviews.Title: Nice but needs better speakers
Reviews.Author: zel22
Reviews.Content: I have this set mounted on a wall in my kitchen so it was a bit hard to get it angled for best picture quality.  I did eventually succeed.  One thing I cannot change is the rather tinny sound.  It needs a more powerful amplifier and better speakers to be a really great TV.

Reviews.Title: Kitchen Wall mount TV
Reviews.Author: G. Wolf "Giftig Wolf"
Reviews.Content: I love that is hooks wirelessly to the internet and we can watch Netflix right in the kitchen. I am sure this TV is much more sophisticated than that, but we are tickled with the great picture and sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Great fit for the gym
Reviews.Author: Michael J Stevens
Reviews.Content: I gave this a 5 star for the speed of shipping, condition of how I received the package, ease of assembly, picture quality, ease of accessing the features we wanted, and type of included apps.This has it all....and all we really wanted was Netflix....Let me start off by saying I'm already a Vizio fan, we have a Blue-Ray player that we just love.I purchased this TV for our in home gym...and was looking for something medium sized with wifi so I really wouldnt need a cable box.This tv has it, is easy to configure and best of all....since we're not using it with cable...the remote has a quick button to go straight to Netflix.....it lets you choose standard Neflix or 'for kids'.The menu is quite simple to navigate.The picture is quality and sound is very good considering its a 24".I wasnt purchasing this for perfect Hi def....or surround sound...so it fits us nicely.I would recommend this tv for anybody wanting a reliable tv with great features, good specs and a built in wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: Perfect as a desktop "smart" TV
Reviews.Author: R C-R
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is excellent; very sharp & detailed. 1080p resolution & the 24" screen size make it an excellent choice for up close, on-your-desktop viewing. Sound quality is about as good as could be expected from a small, thin TV -- it isn't going to wow you with room shaking bass but it's good enough to use without a sound bar for non-critical listening.Vizio partners with Yahoo to supply most of the Internet apps. There are dozens available; most are free. Because the remote doesn't have a full keyboard, you have to use a 'virtual' on-screen one, selecting one character at a time with the cursor keys & clicking the OK button to enter them. It's OK for entering one-time setup info but too slow & cumbersome to use for typing anything else. Since there is no browser app, that isn't much of an issue.There are not many choices for small screen, smart TV's. If that is what you are looking for, I think you won't find a better value than this one.

Reviews.Title: Finally!
Reviews.Author: B. Erdman
Reviews.Content: I have been waiting a long time to replace my old tube TV with one of these.  I am glad I was able to hold out until WiFi enabled TV became affordable.  The picture quality is great.  I can't wait to start using the WiFi and USB port for input.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted!
Reviews.Author: kathkath "kathkath"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive smart tv to put out on my porch.  I wanted one with wifi, Netflix, Pandora, Amazon Video, Hulu and Vudu apps built in.  This tv has all of those and more. It's white trim blends right in with the white walls of my porch.  It is very slim and lightweight.  It was very easy to setup and has a nice crisp hd picture.  I love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Trouble with the picture
Reviews.Author: batts77
Reviews.Content: I would rate this a 5, but I can't figure out the picture. Straight out of the box, all of the people are green and none of the colors are right. If someone could please help with optimal color settings, that would be great.

Reviews.Title: great little tv
Reviews.Author: Harry Vernon
Reviews.Content: easy to use and set up..it was a breeze ..price was great and delivery time was awesome ...would definitely recommend this tv..we bought it to use on our back porch and it's just right

Reviews.Title: Bright White.
Reviews.Author: T
Reviews.Content: Owned one already for the computer room and decided to order one for the kitchen. I wanted a bigger size but they were not 1080p and I would rather have a smaller tv with 1080p than a larger tv with 720p. I will be mounting it in the kitchen as soon as amazon sends the wall bracket I ordered. The wifi dropping that others complained about did happen with my old one. (Bought it from Sam's Club) but this one seems to not have that problem, it is refurbished so maybe that problem got addressed. It was received in very close to like new condition and I'm extremely anal about how my stuff looks and it passed my test so I'm sure it will pass yours. I only purchase Vizio TV's and this falls right in line with one of their best products.

Reviews.Title: Back stand is stupid
Reviews.Author: Avec Nourriture
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice tv for a guest room (which is why I got it). the SMART functions are clumsy but okay. Biggest problem is the ridiculous permanent back stand which forces you to use all sorts of props to make sure the LED glare off the screen is not present. I should have headed some warnings in the reviews about this, but it seemed trivial. Still, decent value.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Roger M. Oliver
Reviews.Content: The TV was exactly as advertised and was perfect for the use I had in mind.  The quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: A great little TV.
Reviews.Author: Kay Gray
Reviews.Content: The colour (white) fits in beautifully with my décor.  The display (LED) is excellent.  I'm very pleased with the product.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: jeffrey p bash
Reviews.Content: We needed a new TV for a counter in a white kitchen.  This fit the bill perfectly as to style, size and fitting under the cabinets.  The picture is great, but note that we do not use advanced features.  Th only minor downside is that it does not display a picture instantly upon turning on, but takes several seconds to show it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Robert C Miller
Reviews.Content: I ordered a white TV and received a black TV, picture is OK , the speakers could be upgraded. For the price I kept it.

Reviews.Title: Decent kitchen TV
Reviews.Author: Sam Crutsinger "Media Kingpin"
Reviews.Content: This TV isn't bad, but it's not great. It takes about 15 seconds for it to come on. That's my #1 beef.The apps interface is a little odd. It's a single file lower screen banner, so if you have many apps loaded on, you have to side scroll quite a bit to find what you're looking for. It doesn't have Plex or a DLNA client at this time which is a bummer. Netflix, Amazon Prime, and Hulu all work well.It has VESA mounting.

Reviews.Title: Great for what it is, a 2nd/3rd TV with Netflix
Reviews.Author: Palmy
Reviews.Content: Great picture, fair sound, easy remote to use.  The stand seems a bit useless to me, but it's made for mounting on a wall (100 x 100 VESA mounts).  I have it set up in the kitchen on a wall, with the power cable and the HDMI, it only has 2 easily hidden cables coming out of it (Yay!).  For the street price, you can't go wrong.Some negatives (if they matter to you)...So slow to boot up. No really, I haven't seen boot up times like this since Windows 3.1I needed a 15' power cord without using an extension... it was hard to find a replacement.Sound is only fair, a bit thin.1 HDMI input.. 1!?Entering text into the setups (WiFi) - The remote is easy, but nav'ing the setup screens without a keyboard is a painOtherwise, I have had it for 2 weeks and love having Netflix in the kitchen without having to figure out where to put a Blu-Ray player.

Reviews.Title: Lasted less than one  month.
Reviews.Author: PC63
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. Returned for credit. Many reviews have recently cited this problem! In any case do not buy this item!!!!

Reviews.Title: Cool
Reviews.Author: Mykull
Reviews.Content: VIZIO E241i-A1w 24-Inch 1080p 60Hz Smart LED HDTV is as cool in real if as it is on the internet.

Reviews.Title: Best tv I've ever had
Reviews.Author: lt
Reviews.Content: This has exceeded my expectations in every way.  The picture is great, the design is elegant, customer service was very helpful when I needed a bit of help figuring things out in the beginning.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in the sound quanlity of speakers
Reviews.Author: Diane Andre
Reviews.Content: The speakers sound very high... no bass.  That was disappointing, since other reviews I recall, said they very very good, for a 24" tv.  But, I am an audiophile.  My husband, to whom the tv is for, said he didn't notice it, and the same with our 21 year old son.  But compared to my 47" 1 year old Vizio, it is very poor sound quality, I think.  Other than that, tv works fine.  We do not have internet at our house, so I can't comment on that.  My husband does play two older nintendo, and game cube games thru it too, and is very happy with that as well, which is all connected thru a dvd recorder player... panasonic, commercial grade machine.  Color, and picture are good, and the white frame is nice... helps the 24" size feel larger, as I had hoped.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, great price
Reviews.Author: jjbv
Reviews.Content: Good size and color for a kitchen.  Has worked out really well and has built in wifi connections as well

Reviews.Title: Great bedroom TV...
Reviews.Author: scott482002
Reviews.Content: Love this little TV.  The picture is great and the WIFI is pretty cool. I have it in my bedroom, on the dresser, and it's lightness and design of the stand make it possible to put on top of the cable box. My only complaint is it isn't available in black.

Reviews.Title: Hanging on the wall in two of the guest rooms
Reviews.Author: Daniel M. Patoyian "Old Guy"
Reviews.Content: Very nice, and the only white sets my wife could find. Connecting to the internet without wires also makes for an easier, cleaner installation. We bought two, if we had more guest rooms, we would have bought more

Reviews.Title: Typical of Vizio
Reviews.Author: Garby Rator
Reviews.Content: This is my second Vizio TV, purchased on the quality of my first.  The built in Wifi was what sold me on the TV since it is mounted in a bathroom, didn't want to have to run Cat5 cable to the bathroom.  Good picture, sound is as expected with a small flat screen, not much room for speakers.  Fits all 100X100 mounting brackets.  WiFi connected quickly and setup is easy.  Entering information is a little tedious with the remote for entering passwords and email addresses, but without a keyboard remote found on the more expensive TV's, it's expected.

Reviews.Title: Kitchen TV - smarter than me!
Reviews.Author: Valerie Behrens
Reviews.Content: I love this tv for it's looks. I wanted a white tv for my kitchen.  It works great, although I haven't used all of it's smart features yet. It is a really great addition to my kitchen, and the cost was very reasonable!

Reviews.Title: My review of the Vizio Smart 24” TV 241i-A1w 1080p
Reviews.Author: Bob B "Newbie to Tech"
Reviews.Content: Speakers: Good sound. Color: White which is better than the usual Black.Apps on the Screen: Not many apps available. I find it a pain having to key in one letter or number at a time. There is no pointing device. I would have to give the apps 2 out of 5. Is there any possibility to add more apps and remove those factory preset apps? In other words, can I customize the apps to my liking?Wi-Fi Connection: I do not know why every time I switch off the TV and then turn it on, I have to re-input my password to get connected to my router? How come the TV does not “save” those settings? The wi-fi antenna was quite sensitive in picking up neighboring signals including my own router with 5 bars out of 5. So for that, I would give the Wi-Fi 4 out of 5. I docked one point because it would not save my router password. It was a pain every time I have to key in my password to get connected. Is there any chance for Vizio to allow us to attach our own external Wi-Fi card to connect to the router?TV Tuner: I find the ATSC tuner quite sensitive. It was able to pick up most channels (taking into consideration other factors such as placement of antenna, time of day or night, weather conditions and the power of the transmitter.) I would give the tuner 4 out of 5.Tuner Functions: I find it peculiar that I cannot do a direct access channel input to receive a channel. It would not allow me. Why so rigid? I have 2 other TVs that allowed me to key in, say channel 17- to scan for a digital channel. Let’s say channel 17 is the physical channel and the virtual channel is 62.1 and 62.2. I would have to go to Menu/Settings/TV and then do a Partial Scan to get those 2 channels. Why so long winded? I had to do multiple Partial Scans because I had to place my antenna at 2 different locations to receive all the available channels. I cannot do a Full Scan because it would mean that some channels would be lost when I do a rescan. So for the poor logic in forcing users to do a Partial Scan and not allowing direct search, I would have to give the tuner function 3 out of 5.Also, say an existing channel, 25.1 (physical channel 33) was already scanned and saved in the system and later the station decided to add another sub-channel, 25.2, the tuner will not automatically display 25.2. You will have to do a partial scan on channel 33 to get 25.2. It will say, found 2 digital channels and then you could do a channel listing by pressing OK and see that channel 25.2 was added to 25.1.My other TV is able to automatically display channel 25.2 without me having to do any rescan. This is because 25.2 is a sub-channel. Should a new channel is launched in my area; I could just key in the physical channel number and add a dash for digital, e.g. 18- and I will get e.g. 69.1, 69.2 and 69.3. I find this channel scanning by Vizio very rigid and illogical.Wish List: The TV only came with one HDMI. Vizio should at least give us 2 HDMI ports. One HDMI for connecting a DVD or Blu-Ray player and the other HDMI could be used to connect a game console or satellite tuner, etc. My 14” TV has 2 HDMI ports. Why only one USB? There should also be 2 USB ports, one for connecting a mouse and the other to connect a SD card using a card reader or pen drive. Why no Bluetooth? With Bluetooth connectivity, I could connect a headset without being tethered to the TV. Also I could connect external speakers using Bluetooth.Remote Control: I find it puzzling that the INFO button and GUIDE was the same function. When I pressed the GUIDE button, it displayed whatever INFO was telling me. I could not get upcoming programs, e.g. the next few hours on that channel. I can only get what was showing currently. My small but humble 14” TV was able to tell me upcoming programs for the next 12 hours when I pressed EPG.Also, when I pressed the INFO button, it did not display the signal strength of the station. My other TV was able to tell me if the signal was strong average or weak. I find the engineers at Vizio forgot to take care of the little things that could mean a lot when designing the TV functions. After all, most functions are now written in Java and can easily be updated by flashing the firmware. I hope they could give us an updated firmware to make the functions easier to use and more logical.Why no MTS or SAP? It seemed that Vizio has forgotten the basics. Almost all TVs nowadays come with both CC and MTS functions. This TV is not for the disabled. I do not understand why there are so many CCs. There are four CCs and 6 CSs. Only CC1 and CS1 worked. So if the program is in Spanish, then CC1 will display the dialogue in Spanish. For English channels, CC1 will display English.Why must I press so many times to turn on CC or to turn it off? Why cannot I just toggle it to CC ON and CC OFF like most other TVs. All I needed to do is to go to settings and then set up which CC to use. So if I wanted Spanish, I select CC4 and CC1 for English. Then I just press the CC button and toggle it from CC OFF to CC ON and automatically the CC will be in Spanish or English as the case may be. Simple! Hence I will have to give the CC and no MTS or SAP functions ZERO stars out of 5.Other functions or rather Non-Functions: No Favourite Channel List, non-existent Electronic Program Guide which is so basic. The Channel List is activated by pressing the OK button on the Remote Control. It displays all the Channels in a single page so it is very tedious to scroll down all the channels if you happen to have many. On my small 14” TV, the channel list is displayed in pages. So if there are 35 channels available, there will be 4 pages. Each page will display a maximum of 10 channels so I could just press “right arrow” or “left arrow” to move to page 2 or 3 and then “down arrow” key to select the desired channel. This is faster than having all channels on a single page. I have a broken TV that also displays pages with 7 channels per page. Why put everything on a single page?All things considered, I would say, the TV could have been better. Although the picture and sound was above average, the lack of certain functional features was apparent. Overall performance: 2 out of 5. I kept this TV and did not return it because of the sound and picture quality plus the sensitive ATSC tuner. Otherwise, I would not hesitate to return this TV and ask for a refund. I needed a replacement TV and so I bought this one thinking that it would be better than the broken one but I was mistaken. I will be keeping my 14” TV as a backup in case this Vizio TV goes kaput after one year.My Conclusion: Certain functions or non-functions really need improvements. The design, navigation and logic offered by Vizio did not quite make sense. Too much thought was put into the Internet part and too little on the basics. As they say, it is the little things that make or break a product. I suggest Vizio R&D; go back to the drawing board and redesign and redevelop the product and if possible give us a patch to download and update the TV’s firmware.

Reviews.Title: Good, but some issues
Reviews.Author: lion13
Reviews.Content: This is a good TV , great image, fairly priced but here are the "cons":1- Poor wifi hardware: Netflix and Hulu had several time loops between the broadcasting, no matter that the Vizio its just 10ft away from router, a Panasonic smart tv that is 50 ft away from router, doesn't present this issue2- Dead pixel, I've had this Tv from 2 months now, and it showed a dead pixel in the center of the display so it's bad...real bad3- When you power it up, It takes like 20 seconds to show some image and almost 1 minute after it shows image, you are able to log in into netflix or hulu or amazon, this is annoying sometimes.This is good for a kitchen tv

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: R. Browning "t5grrr"
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately it was doa so I was not able to give it a real test. A replacement purchased from Costco worked great tho.

Reviews.Title: okay for the price
Reviews.Author: Particular Fuss Pot
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a bedroom and I like that it is white and has netflix.Pros:Easy enough to set upEasy to use,Sometimes the picture is goodEasy to use NetflixCons:Hard to see faces in night time shots...my 15" was better, my 14 year old rear projection is better. I've been playing around with the controls and it's better. At first, most of the preset visual settings made caucasian faces look bright read. I could adjust that with a custom setting, but it got washed out. Played around with the backlight and that helped. Still, not a good picture on many shows. It varies based on channel. Sports and news are fine.The Sound: what everyone else said...my 15" sharp was far better. I didn't think it would bother me because I'm not using it for music, but I am going to get a sound barRemote: No backlight and I watch tv in the dark. I have to have a small flashlight on the bedI have to turn on the cable remote and the Vizio remote. With all my other TVs, I just use my cable remote. I also cannot use the cable remote for volume as with my other tvs; maybe I hooked this one up wrong but it's annoying to use one remote to change channels and another for volume.For the price this is okay, but I wish I'd spent a little more to get a better picture and sound.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV
Reviews.Author: Augustine P.Gebeh
Reviews.Content: This babe is perfect for kitchen or a any busy room.  With wifi capability, you can surf the web and get more for your money. The picture quality is alright and for improve sound quality, I hooked it up to my external speakers and sub woofer.  Going smart is  being the best.I love this babe

Reviews.Title: streaming
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Johnson
Reviews.Content: the t.v will not play my video content meaning avi  etc.etc. customer service from vizio could not help weak but ther customer service is in the u.s. but what good is it if they cannot help

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT SMALL TV
Reviews.Author: A. FUENTES
Reviews.Content: THIS TV. IS REALLY NICE FOR A PERSONAL TV IT HAS GREAT IMAGE. GAMES LOOK GOOD ON IT I PLAY ONE GAME FOR FREE FOR ALL IN CALL OF DUTY AND I WENT 30 TO 1 AND I WAS IMPRESS CAUSE I COULD SEE EVERYTHING SHARP. THE ONLY PROBLEM IS THAT I HAVE A DEAD PIXEL ON IT BUT I THINK I WILL STICK WITH IT

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Yakaly Fernandez
Reviews.Content: Having bought Vizio before I thought this was a sure shot but I was wrong! I don't know if this particular TV was defective or not but it was awful.  I returned it and was very glad that Amazon was very helpful through the process.
